FacilityName: Eugene Welders Supply dba Industrial Source

_prev_prog_3.Description:
Preventative Programs

Fill Stations Emergency

Every Bulkhead filling station is equipped with a breakaway shut down nitrogen powered pneumatic valve.  The purpose of the breakaway shutoff valve is to prevent product release by closing the valves in the unlikely event the fill line becomes disconnected while filling.

All outlets from the storage tanks are equipped with self-closing stop valves in the event of  excessive flow through the valve, the valve closes and the flow is reduced to a limited bleed.

The system is also protected by two shut down switches. The first switch is a shut down switch that  vents off the nitrogen  in the line. Once this switch is moved to the off position, the nitrogen flow to the pneumatic actuators is turned off and simultaneously the pressure is bled from the lines. When this switch is in the off position no product can flow out of the storage tanks. 

The second switch in this circuit is an Emergency Stop switch (E-stop), once the e-stop has been actuated the nitrogen  flow to the pneumatic actuators is turned off and simultaneously the pressure is bled off from the lines.  In addition to shutting down the nitrogen supply and bleeding off the nitrogen line, the e-stop shuts down all electrical supply to the flammable fill island. 

    Fire Engagement Prevention

Passive mitigation, in the form of stock separation and fire barriers (bunkers) have been installed.  The fire barriers are concrete filled cinder block walls, RATED FOR 2 HOURS FIRE PROTECTION. Stock level signs have been posted and employees have been trained on the bunker storage system.  These passive fire protection measures allow additional time for firefighting measures.



Internal Audits

Industrial source performs monthly facility inspections and program audits every three years.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Industrial Source's (Springfield, OR facility) Process Safety Management /Risk Management Plan 

(PSM/RMP) Manual has been prepared in accordance with the EPA regulations 40 CFR 68, "Chemical 

Accident Prevention Provisions," OSHA regulations 29 CFR 1910.119, "Process Safety Management of 

Highly Hazardous Chemicals."  The PSM/RMP plan is available to all employees, their 

representatives, government agencies and the public for review upon written request.



The purpose of the PSM/RMP Manual is to assist with the mitigation and prevention of accidental 

releases of flammable hydrocarbon substances that can cause harm to the public, facility employees, 

and to the environment. Industrial Source (Springfield, OR) location is subject to EPA RMP- Program 

3 requirements, as specified in 40 CFR 68.10, based on the EPA Worst case and Alternative case  on 

the fire exposure endpoint for a worst-case scenario is within the vicinity of public receptors.





Industrial Source operates the Springfield OR. City facility on approximately 4.5 acres on the 

north side of town. The site is situated in an industrial area surrounded by commercial and 

industrial operations.  The Industrial Source facility is bordered to the north by a lumber mill 

and on the eastern border an organic dirt processing facility.  On our southern border is 

Commercial Avenue and 35ᵗʰ street makes up our western border.



The Hydrocarbon fill facility repackages/fills and stores Butane, Isobutane and Propane products. 

The major equipment components of the Hydrocarbon fill plant include three specialty gas bulk 

tanks, one industrial gas bulk tank, piping, and 4 pumps, individual fill lines, and 3  scales. The 

cylinders are pre-fill inspected, vented, evacuated, filled and tested in accordance with 

Industrial Source Standard Operating Procedures.  All steps of the process are recorded 

concurrently in the ACM computerized cylinder tracking program.



Industrial supply has

established operating procedures for all phases of the operation.  All 

employees are trained and annually evaluated for safety and compliance. The fill process is 

generally operated by one employee at a time.  This employee is  responsible for all phases of 

production on that shift. A second employee may be involved in the inspection and venting process, 

if production needs are great.



The process begins when cylinders returned from customers are visually inspected and odor checked 

for contamination.  The residual product is vented into a dump tank until pressure equilibration is 

met between the pressure in the venting tank and the pressure of the dump tank.  The dump tank is 

flared continuously, throughout the venting process, through a flare stack.   The flare stack is 

operated until there is no pressure remaining in the dump tank.



Following the venting process, the cylinders are connected to an evacuation manifold and

vacuum is drawn to 26"Hg .  The cylinders are placed onto a certified electronic scale and



individually filled to 80% capacity using a Blackmer power pump. The process for venting, 

evacuating and filling cylinders does not include any chemical reactions.  However, the flaring 

process is combustion of residual hydrocarbons in returned cylinders.





Safety precautions are in every step of the process, beginning with inventory level segregation. 

Passive mitigation, in the form of stock separation and fire barriers (bunkers) have been 

installed.  The fire barriers are concrete filled cinder block walls, RATED FOR 2 HOURS FIRE 

PROTECTION. Stock level signs have been posted and employees have been trained on the bunker 

storage system.  These passive fire protection measures allow additional time for firefighting 

measures.





The plant equipment was designed and installed to ensure the safest operation.  Bulk supply ports 

are equipped with breakaway shut down valves that are nitrogen-powered pneumatic valve.  Th

e 

purpose of the breakaway shutoff valve is to prevent product release by closing the valves in the 

unlikely event the fill line becomes disconnected while filling.

All other outlets from the storage tanks are equipped with self-closing stop valves in the event of 

excessive flow through the valve, the valve closes and the flow is reduced to a limited bleed.

The filling system is also protected by two shut down switches. The first switch is a shut down 

switch that  vents off the nitrogen  in the line. Once this switch is moved to the off position, 

the nitrogen flow to the pneumatic actuators is turned off and simultaneously the pressure is bled 

from the lines. When this switch is in the off position no product can flow out of the storage 

tanks.

The second switch in this circuit is an Emergency Stop switch (E-stop), once the e-stop has been 

actuated the nitrogen  flow to the pneumatic actuators is turned off and simultaneously the 

pressure is bled off from the lines.  In addition to shutting down the nitrogen supply and bleeding

off the nitrogen line, the e-stop shuts down all electrical supply to the flammable fill island.
